body_html: I have the same issue on Windows 10. I saw that when I use the batched inputs for the fit operation and setting steps=None it works and terminates the training after the epoch is finished. But when I use the same input queue for evaluate and also provide steps=None as parameter, it crashes with the OutOfRangeError.
body_text: I have the same issue on Windows 10. I saw that when I use the batched inputs for the fit operation and setting steps=None it works and terminates the training after the epoch is finished. But when I use the same input queue for evaluate and also provide steps=None as parameter, it crashes with the OutOfRangeError.
body: I have the same issue on Windows 10. I saw that when I use the batched inputs for the fit operation and setting `steps=None` it works and terminates the training after the epoch is finished. But when I use the same input queue for evaluate and also provide `steps=None` as parameter, it crashes with the OutOfRangeError.
